00041 //
00042 // CSoundProcess::CSoundProcess                         - Chapter 12, page 420
00043 //
00044 CSoundProcess::CSoundProcess(shared_ptr<CSoundResource> soundResource, int typeOfSound, int volume, bool looping) :
00045         CProcess(typeOfSound, 0),
00046         m_SoundResource(soundResource),
00047         m_Volume(volume),
00048         m_isLooping(looping)
00049 {
00050         InitializeVolume();
00051 }
00052 
00053 
00054 //
00055 // CSoundProcess::~CSoundProcess                                - Chapter 12, page 420
00056 //
00057 CSoundProcess::~CSoundProcess()
00058 {
00059         if (m_AudioBuffer)
00060         {
00061                 // Note - smart pointers can make some odd looking code, and this
00062                 // is a great example. VReleaseAudioBuffer needs a naked pointer to
00063                 // an IAudioBuffer object. To get this, you have to deref the pointer
00064                 // and then take its address! Strange....but it works.
00065                 g_Audio->VReleaseAudioBuffer(&*m_AudioBuffer);  
00066         }
00067 }
00068

00070 void CSoundProcess::InitializeVolume()
00071 {
00072         //See CProcess.h for the enum PROCESS_TYPE declaration
00073         int typeOfSound = GetType();
00074         
00075         // TODO: SOmewhere set an adjusted volume based on game options
00076         //m_volume = g_GraphicalApp->GetVolume(typeOfSound);
00077 }

00079 //
00080 // CSoundProcess::GetLengthMilli                                        - Chapter 12, 422
00081 //
00082 int CSoundProcess::GetLengthMilli()
00083 {
00084         if ( m_SoundResource )
00085                 return m_SoundResource->GetLengthMilli();
00086         else
00087                 return 0;
00088 }
00089 
00090 //
00091 // CSoundProcess::OnInitialize                          - Chapter 12, page 420
00092 //
00093 void CSoundProcess::OnInitialize()
00094 {
00095         //If the sound has never been... you know... then Play it for the very first time
00096         if ( ! m_SoundResource )
00097                 return;
00098 
00099         m_SoundResource->VInitialize();
00100 
00101         //This sound will manage it's own handle in the other thread
00102         IAudioBuffer *buffer = g_Audio->VInitAudioBuffer(m_SoundResource);
00103 
00104         if (!buffer)
00105         {
00106                 Kill();
00107                 return;
00108         }
00109 
00110         m_AudioBuffer.reset(buffer);    
00111 
00112         Play(m_Volume, m_isLooping);
00113 }
00114 
00115 //
00116 // CSoundProcess::OnUpdate                              - Chapter 12, 421
00117 //
00118 void CSoundProcess::OnUpdate(const int deltaMilliseconds)
00119 {
00120         // Call base
00121         CProcess::OnUpdate(deltaMilliseconds);
00122 
00123         if ( ! m_bInitialUpdate && ! IsPlaying() )
00124         {
00125                 Kill();
00126         }
00127 
00128         if ( IsDead() && IsLooping() )
00129         {
00130                 Replay();
00131         }
00132 }
00133 
00134 //
00135 // CSoundProcess::IsPlaying                                     - Chapter 12, 421
00136 //
00137 bool CSoundProcess::IsPlaying()
00138 {
00139         if ( ! m_SoundResource || ! m_AudioBuffer )
00140                 return false;
00141         
00142         return m_AudioBuffer->VIsPlaying();
00143 }
00144 
00145 //
00146 // CSoundProcess::OnInitialize                          - Chapter 12, page 420
00147 //
00148 void CSoundProcess::SetVolume(int volume)
00149 {
00150         if(m_AudioBuffer==NULL)
00151         {
00152                 return;
00153         }
00154 
00155         assert(volume>=0 && volume<=100 && "Volume must be a number between 0 and 100");
00156         m_Volume = volume;
00157         m_AudioBuffer->VSetVolume(volume);
00158 }
00159 
00160 //
00161 // CSoundProcess::GetVolume                             - Chapter 12, page 422
00162 //
00163 int CSoundProcess::GetVolume()
00164 {
00165         if(m_AudioBuffer==NULL)
00166         {
00167                 return 0;
00168         }
00169 
00170         m_Volume = m_AudioBuffer->VGetVolume();
00171         return m_Volume;
00172 }
00173 
00174 //
00175 // CSoundProcess::TogglePause                           - Chapter 12, page 422
00176 //
00177 void CSoundProcess::TogglePause()
00178 {
00179         if(m_AudioBuffer)
00180         {
00181                 m_AudioBuffer->VTogglePause();
00182         }
00183 }

00185 //
00186 // CSoundProcess::Kill                          - Chapter 12, 421
00187 //
00188 void CSoundProcess::Kill()
00189 {
00190         CProcess::Kill();
00191         if ( IsPlaying() )
00192                 Stop();
00193 }
00194 
00195 //
00196 // CSoundProcess::Play                          - Chapter 12, page 423
00197 //
00198 void CSoundProcess::Play(const int volume, const bool looping)
00199 {
00200         assert(volume>=0 && volume<=100 && "Volume must be a number between 0 and 100");
00201 
00202         if(!m_AudioBuffer)
00203         {
00204                 return;
00205         }
00206         
00207         m_AudioBuffer->VPlay(volume, looping);
00208 }
00209 
00210 //
00211 // CSoundProcess::Stop                                  - Chapter 12, page 423
00212 //
00213 void CSoundProcess::Stop()
00214 {
00215         if(m_AudioBuffer)
00216         {
00217                 m_AudioBuffer->VStop();
00218         }
00219 }

00221 //
00222 // CSoundProcess::GetProgress                   - Chapter 12, page 423
00223 //
00224 float CSoundProcess::GetProgress()
00225 {
00226         if (m_AudioBuffer)
00227         {
00228                 return m_AudioBuffer->VGetProgress();
00229         }
00230 
00231         return 0.0f;
00232 }

00242 void CExplosionProcess::OnInitialize()
00243 {
00244         CProcess::OnInitialize();
00245         shared_ptr<CSoundResource> resource(GCC_NEW CSoundResource(std::wstring(_T("data/explosion.wav"))));
00246         m_Sound.reset(GCC_NEW CSoundProcess(resource));
00247 
00248         // Imagine cool explosion graphics setup code here!!!!
00249         //
00250         //
00251         //
00252 }

00254 //
00255 // CExplosionProcess::OnUpdate                                  - Chapter 12, page 426
00256 //
00257 void CExplosionProcess::OnUpdate(const int deltaMilliseconds)
00258 {
00259         // Since the sound is the real pacing mechanism - we ignore deltaMilliseconds
00260         float progress = m_Sound->GetProgress();
00261         
00262         switch (m_Stage)
00263         {
00264                 case 0:
00265                         if (progress>0.55f)
00266                         {
00267                                 ++m_Stage;
00268                                 // Imagine secondary explosion effect launch right here!
00269                         }
00270                         break;
00271 
00272                 case 1:
00273                         if (progress>0.75f)
00274                         {
00275                                 ++m_Stage;
00276                                 // Imagine tertiary explosion effect launch right here!
00277                         }
00278                         break;
00279 
00280                 default:
00281                         break;
00282         }
00283 }

00286 // 
00287 // CFadeProcess Implementation 
00288 //
00290 
00291 //
00292 // CFadeProcess::CFadeProcess                           - Chapter 12, page 427
00293 //
00294 CFadeProcess::CFadeProcess(shared_ptr<CSoundProcess> sound, int fadeTime, int endVolume)
00295 : CProcess(PROC_INTERPOLATOR)
00296 {
00297         m_Sound = sound;
00298         m_TotalFadeTime = fadeTime;
00299         m_StartVolume = sound->GetVolume();
00300         m_EndVolume = endVolume;
00301         m_ElapsedTime = 0;
00302 
00303         OnUpdate(0);
00304 }
00305 
00306 //
00307 // CFadeProcess::OnUpdate                                       - Chapter 12, page 428
00308 //
00309 void CFadeProcess::OnUpdate(const int deltaMilliseconds)
00310 {
00311         if (!m_bInitialUpdate)
00312         {
00313                 m_ElapsedTime += deltaMilliseconds;
00314         }
00315 
00316         CProcess::OnUpdate(deltaMilliseconds);
00317 
00318         if (m_Sound->IsDead())
00319                 Kill();
00320 
00321         float cooef = (float)m_ElapsedTime / m_TotalFadeTime;
00322         if (cooef>1.0f)
00323                 cooef = 1.0f;
00324         if (cooef<0.0f)
00325                 cooef = 0.0f;
00326 
00327         int newVolume = m_StartVolume + ( float(m_EndVolume - m_StartVolume) * cooef);
00328 
00329         if (m_ElapsedTime >= m_TotalFadeTime)
00330         {
00331                 newVolume = m_EndVolume;
00332                 Kill();
00333         }
00334 
00335         m_Sound->SetVolume(newVolume);
00336 }
